name: TheAtlantic
text: "I got an antibody test recently and it came back negative. Does that mean I don’t have the neutralizing antibodies?" https://t.co/dcKnc8AVHy

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Through the entire American story, white Christianity has served as the central source of moral legitimacy for a society explicitly built to value the lives of white people over Black people," @robertpjones writes: https://t.co/l3o8h9Qa9C

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Apparently powerless to stop the chaos, Trump has now decided to embrace it, hoping that if he was unable to deliver the security he promised, perhaps heightened fear would motivate voters nearly as well," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/Rentqcw82c

name: TheAtlantic
text: With its latest “Tenet” announcement, Warner Bros. finally acknowledged reality: The U.S. is not ready for big films to return, and the country has lost its position as the most important movie market in the world, @davidlsims writes. https://t.co/jQpLb9CPVf

name: TheAtlantic
text: The risk of catching COVID-19 is much lower outdoors. So why aren't more schools considering holding classes outside? @olgakhazan reports: https://t.co/Li2ROaf31n

name: TheAtlantic
text: With its latest “Tenet” announcement, Warner Bros. finally acknowledged reality: The U.S. is not ready for big films to return, and the country has lost its position as the most important movie market in the world, @davidlsims writes. https://t.co/VYn3xaQEiV

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Even as bodies break down and memories start to fade," writes @JamesHamblin, "as long as people have the cognitive capacity to make decisions for themselves, our job as caregivers is to enable fulfillment of those wishes." https://t.co/u6RfhjBdjQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Taylor Swift's outward-looking approach on “Folklore” has made her a better writer, and it might just create better listeners, @skornhaber writes: https://t.co/sM8dEueQbm

name: TheAtlantic
text: Lonely Days for Sports Mascots—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/f7qx5VTIjL

name: TheAtlantic
text: Congress is grilling the tech giants today—but many other industries also deserve antitrust scrutiny, @ddayen writes: https://t.co/10j4d4vDXE

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Atlantic Daily: 'The U.S. Is Simply Not Ready for Big Films to Return', by @mimbsy https://t.co/r5b50tdE1X

name: TheAtlantic
text: Children who have experienced abuse or dysfunction often have difficulty learning—but an Oklahoma teacher named Heather Boyle knows how to work with them. @laura11D reports: https://t.co/FEbwRvNeNv

name: TheAtlantic
text: Lonely Days for Sports Mascots—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/GABbEBWhQe

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Even if Congress somehow decreed the breakup of all four tech giants, the U.S. would still have an astounding number of industries controlled by a tiny number of firms," @ddayen writes: https://t.co/EPcZjBuMo8

name: TheAtlantic
text: Donald Trump promised religious voters that he would protect them with his Supreme Court appointments. The justices are not necessarily playing along. @emmaogreen reports: https://t.co/GsSjJhIo5D

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Even if Congress somehow decreed the breakup of all four tech giants, the U.S. would still have an astounding number of industries controlled by a tiny number of firms," @ddayen writes: https://t.co/NqmjUOrlRE

name: TheAtlantic
text: Donald Trump promised religious voters that he would protect them with his Supreme Court appointments. The justices are not necessarily playing along. @emmaogreen reports: https://t.co/knFFGkEX49

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Flitcraft parable is a warning to white people: If you're not careful, you will find peace again. You will find comfort in a world designed with you in mind. The novelist Richard Russo writes about a parable for this historical moment: https://t.co/KBpftbdEZK

name: TheAtlantic
text: Two writers reflect on the country’s complicated relationship with super businesses—as well as its willingness to tolerate them. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/w6ZiFA4yPL

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @FranklinFoer: My dispatch from yesterday’s hearings: they made the break up of big tech more plausible.  https://t.co/LRfcpttiLJ

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "At certain moments these days, he removes his mask from his pocket and waves it around like a little flag at an Independence Day parade—not as good as actually wearing it, but … progress." -- Andrew Ferguson on Trump:
https://t.co/WyFah2NO3r

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: “Nothing appears to change, only to persist, even as spectacles like this one demand intervention.” https://t.co/z8oEeVDBRN

name: TheAtlantic
text: Lasting happiness comes from deeply ordinary things, like time spent with loved ones—not from achievement or acclaim. But the "success addict" would rather be special than happy, @arthurbrooks writes in this week's How to Build a Life: https://t.co/QrQ6loRL0O

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @edyong209: This is an essential, terrifying, and deeply reported piece from @andersen on how China is using AI for totalitarian surveillance and exporting that tech to other regimes. 

https://t.co/8K04MtnQe4

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @andersen: 1/12 This is a thread about my new feature from our September issue.

It's called 'When China Sees All.' 

Last year, when such things were still possible, I visited one of China's national labs for artificial intelligence.

https://t.co/oUyOcQRglh https://t.co/ELkQHOMKIF

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: President Trump just explicitly suggested delaying the November election. A good time to read this one: https://t.co/oQSy7rBWEO

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @julieebeck: Lasting happiness comes from deeply ordinary things, @arthurbrooks writes — but “success addicts” turn away from those things in the pursuit of more and more achievement, and are never fully satisfied
https://t.co/s8llxW3AbD

name: TheAtlantic
text: The NBA’s insulated bubble in Florida recalls the ancient Olympic Games, ratcheting up the symbolism of athletic performance on a stage set apart from society. @dannychau on the league’s uneasy return: https://t.co/s0kClFHlsN

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @BarbMcQuade: And there it is. Trump floats the idea of delaying the election. Only Congres can change the date of the election. And even so, without an election, Trump’s term expires on Jan 20, 2021. Here is my piece on this topic in @TheAtlantic. https://t.co/lw4vzA5wDM https://t.co/buQsws7NSf

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @zeynep: Ventilation in July is like masks in March. There's accumulating evidence AND many practical steps to take. Some are within our reach for free or cheap, and we should prioritize the expensive ones. Instead, we're stuck, without guidance. Let's change this. https://t.co/1j4KnrCugU

name: TheAtlantic
text: 1/ Donald Trump has suggested delaying the presidential election due to the pandemic. Only Congress can do that, but, as @LizaGoitein reported in 2019, the full scope of the president's emergency powers could threaten to end the constitutional order: https://t.co/ALZe5M6OaB

name: TheAtlantic
text: 2/ “Even under a normal president, the coronavirus pandemic would present real challenges to the 2020 American election,” Jeffrey Davis wrote in March. “Under President Donald Trump, the possibilities … are all the more concerning.” https://t.co/oOv2RLjFAO

name: TheAtlantic
text: 3/ “There’s no assurance that Trump will accept the validity of the election results,” @PeterAtlantic reported in June. “The potential for chaos exposes the frailties of an electoral tradition that depends on the goodwill of the two candidates involved.” https://t.co/xpBDsk4xvZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Donning masks, congressional lawmakers interrogated big-tech CEOs over videoconference. But all business is tech business now, and the pandemic has only increased technology’s power, writes @ibogost. https://t.co/bqYGFVxYcz

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @PeterAtlantic: In light of the president's tweet this morning floating an election delay, it's worth noting that, under the Constitution, his term ends on Jan. 20th.  Re-upping our story. https://t.co/gNpeOHofAk

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Black Lives Matter demonstrations will shake up the 2020 election and reshape American politics for a generation to come, writes @DanielGillion. https://t.co/zTxYlledpw

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump probably cannot postpone the election, the bedrock of American democracy, but the greater danger is that he can destroy its legitimacy," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/DBnHrnRVsx

name: TheAtlantic
text: Watch live: Editor in chief @jeffreygoldberg interviews staff writer @TomMcTague on America’s changing role as a global leader. https://t.co/qQZUNBvCVR

name: TheAtlantic
text: NASA's most sophisticated Mars rover yet has left Earth. Its mission is to find long-dead microbes in the rust-colored soil and package them up to send back home, @marinakoren reports: https://t.co/YjXkt6uBqS

name: TheAtlantic
text: The U.S. Treasury is poised to recommend action against TikTok. @MichaelSchuman speaks with the founder of the company that owns TikTok and asks, why is America so afraid of a goofy video app for teens? https://t.co/l3FAKg0txL

name: TheAtlantic
text: Former President Barack Obama spoke during the funeral of Representative John Lewis. Here are his full remarks, from @realcpaz: https://t.co/9dCLiD02I3

name: TheAtlantic
text: At Rep. John Lewis's funeral service, former President Barack Obama said Lewis will be a "founding father of that fuller, fairer, better America." Adam Serwer writes that without activists like Lewis, the U.S. would not have been free for all its citizens. https://t.co/4EcXvjNLF7

name: TheAtlantic
text: We have no idea what the social web could have looked like if one superpower hadn’t made it all look the same. Facebook's wacky new Geocities-inspired app just makes that clear, @kait_tiffany reports. https://t.co/W2uUNxnIsI

name: TheAtlantic
text: At John Lewis's funeral today, Barack Obama called on Democrats to end the Senate filibuster—which he deemed a "Jim Crow relic"—if Republicans use it to block a new Voting Rights Act. Pressure on Democrats to eliminate the mechanism is likely to grow: https://t.co/5e63FOVezz

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @MichaelSchuman: The battle over #TikTok is, at its heart, a test of American values. My latest in @TheAtlantic  https://t.co/WIYMw2HOcc

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @olgakhazan: Great @arthurbrooks column about people who would rather be special than happy. Does that describe you? https://t.co/CQiNkagPqb
